This is achieved through a separate intake fan and duct, with the duct interposed between the access opening of the machine housing and the open ends of the interior tubs. The system includes a normally closed valve that is opened in response to the access door being opened, allowing air to be drawn into the access opening and directly into the interposed duct. This design minimizes the loss of solvent vapors to the atmosphere.

2. The machine also features a refrigeration system that condenses solvent vapors in the condenser box and maintains the liquid solvent in the storage tank at a predetermined temperature to minimize vaporization. The system operates to cool the storage tank under all portions of the cycle except the drying portion. During the dry portion, the refrigeration unit is continuously energized to condense the solvent vapors passing through the condenser housing. The system has a single compressor that alternatively cools two distinct evaporator coils under either a continuously timed demand or a cyclical temperature responsive demand.</summary>

<summary>
1. The present invention relates to methods and apparatus for spinning thermoplastic polymer filaments, particularly using non-eductive drawing, which overcomes the disadvantages and limitations of prior art eductive and non-eductive systems.
2. The system and method of the present invention involve an initial quench chamber and a continuous two-dimensional slot across the entire machine width, producing a linear plane of filaments with substantially constant filament distribution across the machine width.
3. The invention provides a simple and efficient design that solves many problems associated with conventional nonwoven spun bond systems, including spinning speed limitations, energy consumption, machine element cleanliness, web uniformity, capital costs, and process control.</summary>

<summary>
1. The sewing machine 1 includes at least one detecting portion, a processor, and a memory, and is configured to detect an ultrasonic wave transmitted from a transmission source and control sewing based on the position of the transmission source. The detecting portion is configured to detect the ultrasonic wave, and the memory stores computer-readable instructions that instruct the sewing machine to execute steps including identifying the position of the transmission source and controlling sewing.

2. The embroidery unit 2 is configured to move the embroidery frame, which holds a work cloth, based on the position of the transmission source identified by the sewing machine. The embroidery unit 2 includes at least one detecting portion and a notifying portion, and is configured to notify the sewing machine of a detection timing at which the ultrasonic wave was detected.

3. The sewing machine 1 can identify a specified position on the work cloth 100 by detecting the ultrasonic wave using the plurality of receivers 94 and 95, and calculating the specified coordinates E based on the transmission timing T1 and the detection timings T2. The sewing machine 1 can accurately identify the specified position and start sewing from the specified position.

4. The fourth embodiment is different from the first embodiment in that the sewing machine 1 is provided with a receiver 96 in addition to the receivers 94 and 95, and the ultrasonic pen 92 is not provided with the electromagnetic wave output circuit 921. The CPU 61 can detect the ultrasonic wave using the receivers 94, 95, and 96, and calculate the specified coordinates E based on the detection timings T2 of the receivers 94, 95, and 96.</summary>

<summary>

1. The present invention relates to fabrics and textiles, particularly cellulosic fabric or textile materials, and provides preparations for application onto a textile or fabric material to enhance utility. The preparations comprise a blended mixture of wool particles or wool powder and a binding agent, with the functional additive carried by the wool particles. The wool particles or wool powder are preferably of macrofibril size or below.

2. The invention also provides a preparation for application onto a cellulosic fabric material comprising a mixture of powdered bamboo fibre, carrier agents, and binding agents. The non-charcoal fibrous bamboo powder is nano-sized, having an ultrafine particle size of 1 μm or below. Fabric materials treated with ultrafine bamboo fibre powder have good moisture management properties.

3. The method of preparing a preparation for application onto a cellulosic fabric material comprises pulverizing wool to obtain ultrafine wool powder of macrofibril size, forming an ultrafine wool suspension, and adding functional additives to the suspension. The method may also comprise pulverizing bamboo fibre to obtain coarse bamboo powder, adding a wetting agent and bamboo powder into water to form a suspension, and pulverizing the coarse bamboo powder into ultrafine bamboo powder. The functional additives may include anti-UV agents, anti-bacterial agents, or other clothing functions.

4. The preparation may be bonded to or deposited onto the cellulosic fabric by printing, padding, or foam application, and may provide enhanced moisture management, wicking, and/or wrinkling resistance properties to the article. The treated fabric may have improved ultraviolet protection, anti-bacterial properties, and wrinkle recovery properties. The invention also provides a method of evaluating the moisture management properties of textile materials, including wicking and quick drying properties.</summary>

<summary>
1. The present invention relates to an automatic quilting machine that uses two separate computers to control the sewing machine function and the quilting table movement, allowing for independent reprogramming of each function. This system simplifies the process of making adjustments or changes to the stitch or pattern, as only one function needs to be reprogrammed.

2. The machine uses a computer-aided design program to create and duplicate patterns, allowing for precise control over the quilting process. The system can be used to sew complex patterns into large fabrics, such as bedspreads or quilts, with high accuracy and speed.</summary>

<summary>
1. The present invention relates to methods of making nonwoven fabrics, specifically a method of manufacturing a two-sided nonwoven fabric exhibiting a three-dimensional image.
2. The production of conventional textile fabrics is a complex, multi-step process, whereas nonwoven fabrics are produced directly from the carding process, making them more efficient.
3. Nonwoven composite structures typically improve physical properties, such as elongation, by incorporating a support layer or scrim, which can be made of various materials, including polymers, metal screens, and vegetable fibers.
4. The present invention contemplates a method of forming a two-sided nonwoven fabric by hydroentanglement, with a fluid-pervious support layer or scrim acting as a fiber distribution control layer between the two sides.
5. The precursor webs are formed into a three-dimensionally imaged nonwoven fabric by hydroentanglement on a three-dimensional image transfer device, which defines three-dimensional elements against the precursor web.
6. The image transfer device displaces the first fibrous matrix into the three-dimensional topography while the second fibrous matrix is significantly retained on the side away from the three-dimensional topography forced during hydroentanglement.
7. The fabric of the present invention may comprise apertures of various shapes and sizes, which may extend through one or more layers of the fabric.
8. The material of the present invention can be utilized in various end-use products, including disposable absorbent hygiene articles, medical gauze, protective wear, and apparel construction.
9. The present invention provides a nonwoven fabric that exhibits a pronounced three-dimensional image, as well as the requisite mechanical characteristics, making it suitable for a wide range of applications.</summary>

<summary>
1. The invention relates to a device for feeding a strip of material into a sewing machine and sewing it onto a cut of fabric, ensuring continuous operation and allowing for the sewing of relatively stiff strips of material. The device includes a stop that can be moved into the feed path of the strip and retracted after being contacted by the strip, controlling a signal transmitter for a setting means for the stop. The stop is mounted on a two-armed lever that is biased by a spring and can be moved into a position in which the signal transmitter is actuated independently of the strip.

2. The device operates by having the leading edge of the strip of material butt against the stop, causing the stop to pivot and actuate a proximity switch, which starts a sequence control to lower the presser foot and start the sewing machine. The stop is then retracted from the feed path of the strip, and the sewing machine performs the sewing operation, beginning with some backstitches for locking the seam. The device also includes a contact arm that detects when the trailing edge of the strip passes by, releasing the switching processes for stopping the sewing operation.

3. The invention provides a sewing machine control for feeding strip materials to a workpiece that is simple in design, rugged in construction, and economical to manufacture. The device includes a guide apparatus for feeding the strip of material, a control setup with a stop in the feed path of the strip, and a setting means for adjusting the position of the stop. The device ensures accurate and efficient sewing of strips of material onto a cut of fabric, making it suitable for various applications, including the manufacture of automobile seat slipcovers.</summary>

<summary>

1. The present invention relates to a knitting method and a knit fabric for linking a rope- or tape-shaped knit fabric in various garments, such as sweaters, tank tops, and aprons. The invention aims to provide a connective knitting method that overcomes the problems of increased thickness, impaired productivity, and irregular sewing. This method is employed in a knitting procedure of a tape-shaped knit piece and a tape-shaped knit fabric knitted thereby.

2. The invention uses a flat knitting machine with at least a pair of front and rear needle beds, either or both of which are composed movably in a longitudinal direction. Two tape-shaped knit pieces are knitted in a specified length by arbitrary needles in different ranges across the boundary in the longitudinal direction of one of the needle beds. The loop portion of the final course of one of the knit fabrics is transferred to the needles of the other needle bed.

3. The moving side knit fabric and the fixed side knit fabric are knitted to a specific length, and then the rear moving needle bed is moved one pitch to the left, transferring the loop of the moving side knit fabric to the knitting needles of the moving needle bed. The loop stopped on the knitting needle is confronted with the loop of the knitting needle of the adjoining fixed needle bed. The loop on the knitting needle of the moving needle bed is transferred to the loop of the knitting needle of the fixed needle bed and overlaid.

4. A new loop is formed on the overlaid loops by supplying the knitting yarn to the two overlapped loops on the knitting needle of the fixed needle bed. The carrier for feeding the knitting yarn moves to the left of the knitting needle, then to the right, and finally returns to the left before forming the new loop. This process is called "kick-back."

5. The new loop formed on the knitting needle of the fixed needle bed is transferred to the knitting needle of the moving needle bed. The moving needle bed is racked one pitch to the right, transferring the loop of the knitting needle of the moving needle bed to the knitting needle of the fixed needle bed. The loops of the knitting needles of the moving needle bed are transferred to the knitting needles of the fixed needle bed.

6. Three loops are stopped on the knitting needle of the fixed needle bed, and a new loop is formed by supplying the knitting yarn to the three loops. The loops stopped on the knitting needles of the fixed needle bed are transferred to the knitting needles of the moving needle bed. The moving needle bed is racked one

<summary>
1. The invention relates to a flexible traction element, a production line, and a method for producing the traction element, which comprises at least one stranded cable made of a material guaranteeing tensile strength, sheathed by a flexible thermoplastic plastics material layer. The production line includes a reel for unwinding the stranded cables, a device for precise orientation, a heater, an extruder, a cooling trough, a roller store, a cutting device, and a storage roller.

2. The production line can produce band-shaped traction elements with stranded cables arranged on a plane, having cross-sectional external dimensions in the range of 15×1.5 to 100×20 mm. The position of the stranded cables in the embedded plastics material can be adjusted by the relative adjustment of the cable guide/matrix to ±0.1 mm accuracy.

3. The method for embedding at least one stranded cable with a plastics material-coated core strand involves degreasing and/or pretreating the unwound stranded cables, preheating them to a temperature of about ±20° C. of the melting temperature of the flexible thermoplastic plastics material, and sheathing them in the extruder with the liquefied plastics material. The preheating takes place with an induction heater, a flame burner, and/or a hot air heater.

4. The invention provides a traction element with increased flexibility, improved adhesion between the stranded cables and the plastics material jacket, and precise control of the spacing of the stranded cables guaranteeing tensile strength from the band surfaces. The production line can achieve a high running speed in the region of 10 to 60 m/min.

5. The traction elements according to the invention have a wide range of use, particularly suitable for lifting and pulling loads when the traction element is deflected once or repeatedly and/or stored on a coiler, and can be used as electric conductors with appropriate strand material. The stranded cables with coated core strands are preferably embedded in the same flexible thermoplastic plastics material.</summary>

<summary>

1. The invention relates to a new and useful rotary hook arrangement for a lockstitch sewing machine, which aims to minimize the hindrance of the guiding of the needle thread loop and its pull-back after maximum expansion. The invention provides a lockstitch sewing machine having a rotary hook where the holding means are arranged to hinder the guiding of the needle thread loop as little as possible.

2. The invention is an improvement over existing rotary hook arrangements, which have limitations such as brief impediments of thread movement during the upward pull-back, resulting in increased needle thread tension. The invention addresses this issue by arranging the holding means on the loop cast-off side of the bobbin housing.

3. The lockstitch sewing machine comprises a base plate, a standard, and an arm with a head, which carries a thread take-up lever and a thread tensioning device. The rotary hook drive shaft is connected to the arm shaft, which transmits the drive movement to the rotary hook.

4. The lockstitch rotary hook has a hook body and a hook tip, and a bobbin housing supported in the hook body, which comprises a bobbin capsule carrier and a removable bobbin capsule. The bobbin housing has two projections forming a triangular shoulder, with the front and rear side faces of the shoulder being tangential to the generated surface of the bobbin housing.

5. The invention includes a capsule release device, which gives the bobbin housing a rotational impulse counter to the direction of hook rotation, creating a gap between the rear side face of the shoulder and the spring rod. This allows the needle thread loop to slip through the thread passage gap entirely unhindered, reducing the needle thread tension required for satisfactory stitch formation.

6. The rotary hook arrangement is simple in design, rugged in construction, and economical to manufacture, providing a jerk-free and low-friction motion of the needle thread loop. The invention can be embodied otherwise without departing from its principles, and a specific embodiment has been shown and described in detail to illustrate its application.

<summary>

1. The present invention relates to synthesis schemes and methods for producing silicon-based nanostructures and materials, particularly compositions and methods for synthesis of silicon-based nanowires and composites from four-component and five-component inks. The inks comprise a liquid silane, a polymer, an accelerant, and a solvent, with the five-component ink also including a solid phase. The invention provides methods for producing silicon-containing nanowire/fiber composites and thin films using electrospinning. The nanowire products from the liquid silane-based "ink" compositions are produced and characterized.

2. The invention provides four-component or five-component silane inks that can be used in the formation of silicon-based films and nanofibers and composite materials. The inks can also be used with other deposition techniques such as thin film deposition techniques. Single or coaxial nozzle formation of nanofibers is used to illustrate the methods. The inks and methods of the invention are appropriate for any electrospinning technique.

3. The liquid silane monomers used in the invention are relatively unaffected by the high-voltage electrospinning process and remain associated with the polymeric carrier upon evaporation of the solvent. Light-induced or heat-induced radical polymerization of the Si6H12 gives a viscous polydihydrosilane deposit that assumes a geometry related to the structure of the copolymer. The structure of the silicon nanowires prepared from Si6H12/polymer carrier in toluene mixtures appears to be governed by the physics of the copolymer mixtures.

4. The electrospinning of four-component Si6H12/polymer/accelerant inks gives products where the active silicon agent forms after the precursor is transformed to nanosized material. The approach offers the ability to tailor chemical composition of Si wires by adjusting precursor chemistries to give electrospun composites that possess targeted conductivities and maintain structural stability throughout a lifetime of charge/discharge cycles. Barring any undesirable chemical reactivity with Si—Si or Si—H bonds, particles of carbon, metals, and solid electrolytes can also be introduced into liquid silane-based electrospinning inks.

5. The four-component and five-component inks disclosed are particularly useful with electrospinning procedures, and the formation of micro and nanofibers is used as an illustration. However, the inks can also be used with other deposition techniques such as thin film deposition techniques. The inks and

<summary>
1. The present invention is directed to an arrangement for the control of thread tension in a spool creel having several spool holders each provided with a brake rotor working with a braking element that is adjustable by a tensioning lever carrying a roller.
2. The arrangement has a plurality of controllers, each coupled to a different corresponding one of the spool holders, and each of the controllers has a brake rotor and an adjustable, tension responsive, braking element coupled to the brake rotor.
3. The tensioning lever is coupled to the braking element for biasing it and has a roller adapted to engage and be biased by the threads, and is operable to occupy an angular position dependent upon thread tension and weight.
4. A biasing arrangement adapted to be activated by fluid pressure and connected to the tensioning lever, each of the tension levers being simultaneously settable by the fluid pressure, is also included.
5. The force generated by the preferred biasing arrangement operates in addition to the weight force on the tensioning lever, whereby the thread tension is also altered, and this change can be centrally set so that the thread tension can be determined for the entire creel.
6. When the warping machine served by the creel is shut off, the braking force throughout the entire creel can be increased so that a quick braking action is possible.
7. The biasing arrangement is preferably formed by a piston/cylinder assembly, which can readily follow the swinging movement of the tensioning lever by changing their length.
8. The tensioning lever in the total working area subtends an angle A to the horizontal plane of more than 45°, and the working elevation angle of the biasing arrangement attached to the tensioning lever should preferably subtend an angle B of less than 45°.
9. In a preferred modification, the biasing arrangement operates on a brake shoe, which is provided to a further rotating braking surface, and is applied only under higher fluid pressures to a further braking surface, which can cause the braking to occur rather rapidly at the shut down of the warping machine.
10. The brake rotor may advantageously be a brake drum wherein the braking element is a braking band contactable therewith and tensionable by the tensioning lever, or a braking disc of electro-conductive material and the braking element is a magnetic system, which is displaceable by the tensioning lever into a position more or less covering the braking disc.
</summary>

<summary>

1. The present invention relates to a sewing machine detector for detecting the position of a sewing needle and the speed of the sewing machine. The detector is integral with the drive and control elements of the sewing machine. The conventional detector has several disadvantages, including the influence of static noise and the detrimental effects of vibration. The conventional detector also has a relatively thick and non-compact detecting section.

2. The conventional detector includes a detecting section with reflective discs that must withstand constant vibration during the operation of the sewing machine. The reflective discs are curved, making them difficult and expensive to machine. The rotary reflective discs make the detecting section relatively thick and non-compact. The conventional detector also has significant stress imposed on the optical fibers.

3. The conventional detector includes a power indicating light with a light emitting diode and lead wires that can act as antennas, receiving electromagnetic waves and generating an electromotive force. This electromotive force can affect the control device and cause it to operate erroneously. The conventional detector also has a relatively complex construction, with multiple components and connections. The conventional detector is also prone to malfunction due to the influence of static noise.

4. The present invention provides a low-price detector for a sewing machine that is durable despite the detrimental effects of vibration. The detector includes a thinner and more compact detecting section. The detector minimizes stress imposed on the optical fibers by minimizing the curvature of the optical fibers. The detector also provides a power indicating light that does not electrically interfere with the operation of the detector and controller.

5. The detector includes flat, sheet-shaped first, second, and third light shielding discs mounted coaxially to a shaft connected to a sewing machine shaft. The light shielding discs are made of light-transmitting synthetic resin and have printed light shielding areas and angle indications. The second and third light shielding discs are rotatably mounted to the shaft and have indicator arrows printed in different colors. The light shielding discs are used to detect the sewing machine speed, needle UP position, needle DOWN position, and thread trimmer timing position.

6. The detector includes an optical fiber supporter with linear optical fiber fixing holes for locking the ends of the light sending and receiving optical fibers. The optical fiber supporter has first and second reflecting portions provided opposite the end faces of the light sending and receiving optical fibers. The reflecting portions are provided by plating or attaching reflective plates. The optical fiber supporter is fastened to the enclosure of the detecting section.

7. The detector includes a module section with a circuit board fixedly secured to the light

<summary>
1. The present invention relates to a simplified process for the continuous production of viscose rayon yarns with a high degree of whiteness, achieved through a combination of coagulation, washing, and drying treatments.
2. The process involves completing the coagulation of the yarn, which has already been partially coagulated and drawn, to a final coagulation index not higher than 1, and then washing it with water having a non-alkaline pH.
3. The washing treatment reduces the amounts of total sulphur, sulphur bound as sulphides, elemental sulphur, iron, zinc, and lead retained on the yarn to specified values, resulting in a high degree of whiteness.
4. The process can be carried out at spinning speeds of at least 90 m/min, and the washing treatment is preferably performed at temperatures between 20° and 30° C. for a period of time between 25 and 40 seconds.
5. The water used for washing should have a pH between 4.0 and 5.5 and be free from cations in amounts higher than specified limits, and can be obtained by treating industrial distribution network water with weakly acid ion exchange resins.
6. The process produces a finished yarn with a high degree of whiteness, without the need for additional treatments such as bleaching, and has advantages over traditional processes in terms of simplicity, speed, and economy.</summary>

<summary>

1. The patent application is a continuation-in-part of a previous application, Ser. No. 594,455, filed on March 29, 1984, which is now abandoned. The current application aims to address the problem of washing pulp after an oxygen stage in the bleaching process. The inventors have devised a system to deaerate the pulp before washing, which involves a small tank with a swirl-inducing inlet pipe. The system is designed to be compact and efficient, with no moving parts.

2. The background of the invention discusses the challenges of deaerating pulp after an oxygen stage, including the formation of foam that reduces vacuum in the washer. Previous proposals for deaerating pulp include the "Deculator" process, which involves rapid acceleration and spraying of stock into a long receiver under vacuum. However, this system is expensive and requires complex equipment. Another system, described in Sethy's U.S. Pat. No. 4,209,359, uses a radial flow impeller to agitate the slurry.

3. The inventors' system involves a small deaeration tank that can be placed on top of an oxygen reactor, with a swirl-inducing inlet pipe that provides optimum deaeration. The tank has an inlet pipe, an outlet, and a tangential swirl-inducing inlet pipe, with the locations and sizes of these elements carefully designed for maximum efficiency. The system uses the filtrate from the washer as the swirling fluid in the deaeration tank. The tank can be closed and operated under pressure or vacuum.

4. The deaeration tank is typically cylindrical in shape, with an open top and a flat bottom, and has a diameter similar to that of the oxygen reactor. The tank's height is approximately twice its diameter, and the nominal height of the pulp slurry is around 0.8 times the diameter. The inlet pipe is located above the surface of the slurry and extends across the interior of the tank to allow the incoming pulp to strike the side wall. A splash plate is located above the inlet pipe to prevent splashing.

5. The outlet pipe is located in the bottom plate of the deaeration tank and is sized to handle the amount of pulp leaving the tank. The outlet pipe has a center line located in the same vertical plane as the center line of the inlet pipe, and is positioned between 0.15 and 0.4 times the diameter of the tank from the outside of the tank. The filtrate sw

<summary>
1. This invention relates to biomimetic tendon-reinforced (BTR) composite materials with improved properties, including high out-plane stiffness and strength-to-weight ratio, designed using a function-oriented material design (FOMD) process.
2. The BTR composite structure consists of stuffer members, tendon elements, and panels, which can be arranged in various configurations, including flat, curved, and three-dimensional structures, to achieve optimal performance.
3. The FOMD process employs topology optimization to design materials for specific tasks, resulting in innovative structural material concepts, such as the BTR composite, which can be used in various applications, including aerospace, automotive, and marine industries.
4. The BTR composite can be fabricated using various materials and techniques, including the use of hollow stuffer members and bent-wire tendons, which can simplify manufacture and potentially be automated using robotics.</summary>

<summary>

1. The present invention relates to a load-limiting device for braced frames that can dissipate energy during a dynamic event, such as an earthquake, and limit the loads transmitted to the structure. The device is designed to undergo plastic deformation to absorb the energy and can be replaced after the event. The load-limiting device is attached to a brace in the braced frame structure and has a connection means that allows it to be easily removed and replaced. The device can be made of various materials, including metal and plastic.

2. The load-limiting device is designed to provide biaxial support for the braced frame and can withstand high dynamic loads. It has a unique geometry that allows it to deform plastically and dissipate energy during a dynamic event. The device can be used in various structures, including buildings, bridges, and heavy lifting equipment. It can also be used in conjunction with externally mounted braces.

3. The load-limiting device has several advantages over prior art devices, including its ability to dissipate energy during a dynamic event and its ease of replacement after the event. The device can be designed to have a specific load capacity and can be manufactured with different geometries to accommodate various bracing configurations. It can also be used in conjunction with other energy dissipation devices, such as hydraulic dampers. The device is designed to be cost-effective and easy to install.

4. The load-limiting device can be checked after a dynamic event to determine if it has undergone plastic deformation. An indicator means, such as a brittle coat or a mechanical device, can be used to indicate the presence of plastic deformation. If the device has undergone plastic deformation, it can be easily removed and replaced with a new device. The device can be designed to be interchangeable with new devices, making it easy to replace and maintain.</summary>

<summary>
1. The present invention relates to a bedroom cabinet, specifically a unit type bedroom cabinet designed for a flophouse facility with individual rooms on an existing building floor. This cabinet is designed to be compact, with a floor area approximately equal to a bed, and a height allowing a user to sit up comfortably.

2. The prior art bedroom cabinet had several disadvantages, including reduced dwelling area due to protruded portions, decreased mechanical strength, and poor sound-proofing. The present invention aims to overcome these disadvantages by providing a bedroom cabinet with flat external surfaces and improved mechanical strength.

3. The bedroom cabinet of the present invention consists of an outer casing and an inner casing, with a clearance between them that can be used to form boxes for electric devices or shelves for user belongings. This design allows for effective utilization of the dwelling area and enables multiple cabinets to be stacked or installed adjacent to each other.

4. The present invention also provides a bedroom cabinet with a clearance between the outer and inner casings formed over the whole periphery, with spacer members interposed in the clearance to form a uniform air flow passage. This design enables natural ventilation within the room and increases sound-proofing effect.

5. The bedroom cabinet can be assembled by receiving the inner casing into the outer casing, with the flanges of the upper and lower outer casings brought into abutment with each other, and the clearance between the outer and inner casings used to form boxes or shelves for user belongings and electric devices. The cabinet can be equipped with various devices, such as a TV receiver, interphone, and illuminating device, and can be easily installed in a flophouse facility.
</summary>

<summary>
1. The present invention relates to a portable, temporary guard rail support for use in the erection of a safety barrier or fence at sites under construction, such as office buildings or high-rise apartments. The guard rail support comprises a substantially flat bottomed base plate, an upright column, at least one guard rail support bracket, a kick board retaining flange, an angular brace, and a safety tie-off ring. The guard rail support is designed to provide a safe work area for workmen working at dangerous heights.

2. The guard rail support can be assembled and disassembled in an efficient manner, and it reduces or eliminates the liability resulting from inadequately re-installed guard rails. The all-steel construction of the guard rail support ensures durability and repeated use for many years, providing a high return on investment and cost savings. The guard rail support can be used in various situations, such as providing a temporary guard railing around the perimeter of a roof structure or along the sides of a bridge construction.</summary>

<summary>

1. The present invention is a pulsed power device and a method of using the pulsed power device for Enhanced Oil Recovery (EOR). Pulsed power is the rapid release of electrical energy that has been stored in capacitor banks. By varying the inductance of the discharge system, energies from 1 to 100,000 Kilojoules can be released over a pulse period from 1 to 100 microseconds.

2. The invention uses a coupled process of direct EH acoustic vibrations that propagate outward into the formation from one or more wells, and electromagnetically-induced high-frequency acoustic vibrations that are generated using both EH and EM pulsed power discharge devices. This is significantly different from the prior art which relies on acoustic vibrations only, or a combination of acoustic vibrations and low-frequency AC or DC electrical stimulation. The present invention also recognizes that these two effects must occur together to effectively mobilize the oil and increase production of the oil.

3. Effective acoustic stimulation of oil-bearing reservoirs requires higher frequencies than direct acoustic methods can generate and support at great distances from the stimulation source. Every rock formation can be modeled as a uniform equivalent medium with imbedded inclusions. These inclusions can be present at the pore scale, grain scale, crack scale, lamina scale, bedding scale, sand body scale, and larger scales. Each of these inclusions, or features, of the formation act as scatterers that absorb acoustic energy.

4. The present invention differs from all of the prior art in several ways, including the use of a coupled process of direct EH acoustic vibrations and electromagnetically-induced high-frequency acoustic vibrations. The invention also recognizes that these two effects must occur together to effectively mobilize the oil and increase production of the oil. Additionally, the invention uses a multi-level discharge device that allows sequential firing of several sources in one well in a time sequence that is optimized to allow continuous electromagnetic-coupled stimulation of a large reservoir volume.

5. In a preferred embodiment of the present invention, the technique can be applied using a multi-level discharge device that allows sequential firing of several sources in one well in a time sequence that is optimized to allow continuous electromagnetic-coupled stimulation of a large reservoir volume while the electrohydraulic acoustic pulse travels further from the pulse well than it could before a single source electromagnetic vibration would decay. This approach can be used to extend the effective range of the stimulation by a factor of 5-6 from about 1000 feet as claimed and proven in the Wesley patent.

6.

<summary>
1. The present invention relates to a novel design for a plow blade that provides a fluid passage and points of fluid ejection, produced with basic manufacturing processes allowing efficient production. The blade construction includes a multiple component assembly, providing the ability to rebuild a blade by replacing a worn portion. This design allows for the lubrication of the sides of the blade and chute that come into contact with the ground, greatly reducing drag and friction.

2. The plow blade design can be tailored to match specific job requirements, with components manufactured using traditional manufacturing processes. The flow paths are defined by stacking together leading edge sections with flow voids and welding or attaching them to a blade. This configuration provides an easily tailored and functional design, allowing for modifications and variations to be made in light of the above teachings.
</summary>

<summary>
1. The present invention relates to a building system, specifically stucco type cavity wall construction techniques and resultant consumables, subassemblies, assemblies, etc.
2. The invention aims to provide a building system that allows for the creation of panels greater than 2.4 meters in height and 4 meters in width without movement control joints.
3. The system comprises a frame or substructure, battens, a first mesh attached to the battens, a second mesh supported by a plaster matrix, and the plaster matrix applied in multiple layers.
4. The plaster matrix penetrates the first mesh, interposes both meshes, attaches to the second mesh, and covers the second mesh, with additional reinforcement provided at openings and corners.
5. The system is designed to comply with New Zealand building codes NZS3604 and NZS4251, and to provide a useful choice for the public.
6. The invention also includes various components and consumables, such as battens, wall wrap, flashing tape, mesh staples, and plaster, which are used to construct the building system.
7. The system allows for the construction of decks, and the requirements of NZS 3604 must be followed, except to the extent required to account for the junction.
8. The invention provides a building system that is durable, resistant to wind face loading, and able to accommodate movement and settlement of the building structure.</summary>

<summary>
1. The invention relates to a safe adapted to contain valuable papers and articles, with a focus on providing a new and improved readily assembled, low-cost door and safe structure.
2. The safe has a valuables receiving chamber with a generally rectangular opening and a set of grooves formed on the opposite walls, providing stops for retaining the door, with one groove having a depth substantially greater than the other.
3. The door is dimensioned for being received in and completely removed from the open upper end of the chamber, with a lock assembly on the reverse side of the door having a latch bolt engaging a detent in one bar for prevention of lateral movement.
4. The safe construction may be equally applicable to a basic steel safe preassembled at the factory, and various adaptations and modifications may be made within the spirit and scope of the invention.</summary>

1. The invention relates to a fluid measuring technique that more accurately measures the fluid pressure in a geological formation at a desired elevation or depth, without being influenced by pressures in the formation above and below the pressure measuring apparatus.
2. The technique involves cementing a conduit fitted with a filter in a borehole, pressurizing the conduit to clear it of cement grout, and then displacing the grout to achieve a fluid connection between the formation and the filter, allowing for precise measurement of the formation pressure at the desired depth.
</summary>

1. The present invention relates to a jointing structure in vehicle traveling path joints and the like having an expansion function, which is adaptable for applications of various tire configurations different in tire diameter, ensures high slip resistance to tires, permits less occurrence of tire fall-in and/or stuck-in situations, and is easy to be given maintenance. The jointing structure comprises more than one step provided face to face at the coaxially built traveling path ends with an expansion gap between, more than one elastic member respectively mounted inside the above more than one step, and a joint block mounted on the above more than one elastic member across the above expansion gap. The joint block is made of the same concrete as that of the traveling path, which provides more substantially increased slip resistance to the tires. The elastic members are desirably of a material that is hard to be deformed vertically and vice verse easy to be deformed horizontally in a soft manner.

2. The present invention employs elastic members mainly consisting of laminated rubber, which is formed by piling up a thin rubber layer and a steel sheet alternately in multiple layers to place the rubber layers under restraint. The laminated rubber is fixedly placed in detachable fashion on a bottom of each of the step by fastening the base plate to the bottom with more than one anchor bolt. A backing plate is mounted on the laminated rubbers across the expansion gap, so that the laminated rubbers are integrally joined together through the thus mounted backing plate. The laminated rubbers are supposed to get deformed as a unit, following the expansion or contraction or the like of the bridge girders.

3. The joint block has loose holes into which the anchor bolts are respectively inserted, and the loose holes are respectively charged with a hardening material such as mortar. The joint block is firmly fixed in three positions to the upside of the backing plate, and the removal of the joint block from the upside of the backing plate, if required, can be made in such a relatively easy manner as to only crush the hardening material in the loose hole. Each supporting block is fixedly fitted in detachable fashion to the side wall of each step in close contact therewith with more than one mounting bolt. The upper end surface of each supporting block, that of the joint block, and that of each intermediate joint block are made flush with the upper end surface of the traveling path.

<summary>

1. The present invention relates to track transport systems, specifically floor track systems used in sanitary fluid treatment chambers for transporting food stuffs on wheeled hand trucks. These systems are commonly used in processing cooked meat products, such as smoked meat and sausage.

2. Conventional air chilling methods have major drawbacks, including evaporating meat juices, causing dehydration and shrinkage of the product, and having a slow rate of heat transfer from the meat to the air. This dehydration can result in difficulty removing cellulose casing from products like sausage or frankfurters.

3. More recent approaches to chilling cooked meat products employ fluid treatment chambers with a system for showering the meat products with a chilled brine solution to quickly transfer heat from the meat to the solution. The brine solution can then be recovered, recooled, and recirculated.

4. The meat products processed in this manner must be processed in a sanitary environment as required by the U.S. Department of Agriculture. It is also desirable to chill large quantities of meat products at one time and quickly move them about the processing plant.

5. One transport system used in cooling chambers is the overhead rail or trolley, but this system has disadvantages, including fixing the route of transfer and contaminating the brine solution with lubricating grease from the transport wheels. This contamination can be overcome by locating the brine shower system below the overhead track system.

6. Wheeled dolly-like floor trucks offer mobility advantages but have the unsanitary nature of the wheels, which can become contaminated with foreign substances from the processing plant floor. This contamination can be circumvented by retreating to air-chilled chambers, but at the expense of product dehydration and longer cooling cycles.

7. The primary object of the invention is to provide a floor transport system that allows dolly-like floor trucks to be used in a fluid treatment center without contaminating the treatment fluid. Another objective is to provide a floor transport track system that segregates the wheels of the trucks from the recirculated treatment solution.

8. The enclosed floor track system includes a wheel channel into which the wheels of the truck roll, disposed above the fluid level on the floor by support legs. The wheel channel includes opposed sidewalls, one of which extends upwardly more than the other and has a cover plate horizontally overlying the top of the channel.

9. The cover plate may be connected to the longer sidewall by a hinge, allowing it to be pivoted away from the wheel channel for cleaning. The vertical space between the shorter sidewall

<summary>
1. The present invention relates to a lock device that prevents a boom of a backhoe work machine from being rotated downward by its weight, and is designed to be easily operated manually.
2. The lock device comprises an engaging member and an engaged member, where the engaging member is provided on one of the boom and a boom bracket, and the engaged member is provided on the other of the boom and the boom bracket.
3. The engaging member is supported by a support pin and a guide member, and is designed to be slidably moved along a slot to engage with the engaged member, thereby locking the boom in place.
4. The lock device is designed to be simple in construction, easy to assemble, and to reduce the number of parts and assembly processes, making it a practical solution for locking a boom in a work machine.</summary>

1. The present invention relates to swimming pool vacuum cleaning devices, specifically a swimming pool vacuum cleaning apparatus with a flexible platform that allows for precise regulation of suction efficiency during the pool cleaning operation. The device has a central, vacuum portion that is readily adjustable relative to the pool bottom. This adjustability enables real-time regulation of suction efficiency without the need to adjust the vacuum at the circulation pump. The device overcomes the drawbacks of prior art devices, which lack a simple adjustment mechanism on the vacuum head itself.

2. The device of the preferred form of the invention features conveniently located adjustment mechanisms on the top of the suction head, which precisely regulate the spacing between the lower surface of the central, suction portion of the suction head and the bottom of the pool. These adjustment mechanisms are easy to operate by hand without the need for hand tools. The device is designed to provide a simple and efficient way to regulate suction efficiency during the pool cleaning operation. This is particularly useful for commercial pool cleaning operators who need to clean multiple pools with varying suction sources.

3. The suction head assembly of the present invention comprises a generally rectangular, horizontally extending platform with a central portion, longitudinally extending edges, and longitudinally spaced end portions. The central portion of the platform is provided with an opening and an upwardly extending cylindrical member in communication with the opening. A handle assembly is pivotally interconnected with the platform, and the platform and cylindrical member are preferably integrally formed from a yieldably deformable plastic material. The device also features a first, or outboard roller assembly connected to the platform proximate each end portion.

4. The device features a second, or inboard roller assembly interconnected with the platform on either side of the central opening. The inboard roller assemblies include a weight housing with spaced apart ribs, or walls, each of which has an end portion extending outwardly from the edges of the platform. Each end portion is provided with a vertical slot adapted to closely receive an axle member that rotatably carries a roller. The device also features a specially configured frame member connected to and spanning the platform. The frame member has a central portion and spaced end portions that extend outwardly on either side of the longitudinally extending edges of the platform.

5. The roller height adjustment device of the present invention can be provided in kit form for use in combination with certain types of prior art suction head assemblies. The device comprises a pair of frames adapted to be positioned over the walls of the housing of the roller construction so as to span the platform. Each frame includes

1. The present invention relates to oil well drilling tools and apparatuses, specifically an apparatus for retrieving the wear bushing from around the interior of the well head and casing. The apparatus includes a sub-unit for mounting onto the drill string. The wear bushing is used to protect against excessive wear during oil and gas well drilling operations.

2. Wear sleeves or wear bushings are utilized to prevent wear to seal areas of casing heads and other well head elements. They are typically equipped with an interior bore smaller in diameter than the width of the bit. The sleeve may be loosely incorporated on the drill string, resting on the drill bit and lowered to its position.

3. In some cases, it may be desirable to retrieve the wear sleeve or bushing without the use of the bit. For example, when the drill pipe is lodged, the pipe may be backed off above the drill bit and withdrawn from the hole. The drill collars and bit may be left down in the hole, requiring a wash over string to retrieve them.

4. The wash over string is larger in inside diameter than the outside diameter of the drill collar and equal to that of the bit itself. However, this equipment will not go through a normal wear sleeve, making it necessary to remove the wear sleeve or bushing. One method of removal involves using a wear sleeve or bushing section with a J-slot and a retriever body.

5. The retriever body has outwardly protruding dowels or the like for engaging the J-slot. The dowels or the like protrude around the entire radius of the retriever body. This retriever is incorporated in the drill string with the usual pin and box threaded upper and lower ends.

6. The present invention provides a retrieving tool that is removably securable on the exterior surface of a sub-unit. The tool may be mounted on a string of drill pipe independently of threading on the pipe. The retriever apparatus allows for vertical movement of the retrieving unit while allowing rotational movement of the retriever unit during operation.

7. The retriever unit may be mounted onto a mandrel and connected onto drill pipe, allowing for vertical play or movement of the retriever unit. This prevents damage to the retriever unit or the wear bushing due to excessive weight below the retriever. The wear bushing retriever apparatus can be threadably engaged between any two sections of drill pipe without retrieval of the drill bit from the hole.

8. The apparatus includes a sub-unit having a mandrel with a longitudinal bore

1. The field of this invention is downhole vibratory tools, specifically those that allow passage for other tools. These tools are used to dislodge stuck objects, known as fish, from downhole locations. They can also transmit pulling forces from the surface to a fish stuck in a deviated wellbore.

2. Prior vibratory tools have limitations, such as not having a clear central passageway for wireline operations. Most earlier designs required the vibratory tool to be removed to run a wireline or other tools down to the fish. This was due to the dump valve being located in the center of the tool, preventing a clear run through.

3. A more recent design, the drop-in dart, allowed for wireline access but had its own set of limitations. The dart had to be miniaturized to fit into the tool body, which limited the power delivery of the generated vibrations. This design also increased the effects of fatigue on the moving parts and was costly to build and maintain.

4. The present invention addresses the issues with prior designs by reconfiguring the dump valve into an annular shape. This allows for a central passage to exist, permitting wireline operations through the tool when it's not in vibratory mode. The tool can be put into vibratory mode by dropping a removable plug onto a seat.

5. The tool has a modular design, allowing for the stacking of pistons to increase the available piston area. This increases the power of the pressure spike applied to the fish. The impacting of pistons on the housing is optional and depends on the applied overpull to the string.

6. The tool can be operated to deliver high-amplitude, low-frequency oscillating forces to the stuck fish without impacts. The amount of surface overpull applied to the string controls whether jarring blows are delivered in every cycle. The tool can also be operated to have impacts on each cycle with the pistons against the housing.

7. The design of the valve eliminates significant cyclical impacts on opening and closing. The cylindrical shape and seal ring allow for the spring to be more robust, reducing stresses and extending its life. The valve is also designed to avoid banging valve components on a valve seat.

8. The tool can be made to operate with fewer moving parts than previous designs. The plug is simple and cheap, with no moving parts. The components delivered with the tool initially can be bigger, providing longer trouble-free service.

9. The modular design allows for the selection of the number of pistons

<summary>

1. The present invention relates to an apparatus and method for constructing a retaining wall, specifically a completely precast concrete retaining wall used alongside highways and railways. The invention allows for taller walls and shorter bases by pre-manufacturing parts of the wall to be transported to and assembled at the site. This approach saves both on installation and transportation costs.

2. The retaining wall of the present invention is made of precast concrete in two discrete, modular parts: a precast concrete face panel with an integral counterfort piece and a precast base piece. The face panel has surface ornamentation to resemble a stone or brick wall, and the counterfort extends from the rear side of the panel. The counterfort has a flat bottom and can have a generally rectangular or triangular shape.

3. The base is a rectangular or trapezoidal shaped platform, typically set on grade, and is precast concrete, eliminating the need for casting in-situ at the construction site. The base can have a shear key, which is a depression sized to accept the bottom of the front face panel, and can be filled with grout to solidify the connection. The base can also have openings to accept downward-extending rebar ends from the counterfort.

4. The connection between the face panel and base is made by inserting an end of a piece of rebar into an opening in the other module and sealing the connection with grout. The installer places the base into a substantially horizontal position, raises the face panel above the base, and aligns the exposed ends of the rebars with the openings on the base. The face panel is then lowered onto the base, and the anchor is simultaneously lowered into an opening in the base.

5. The invention allows for flexibility between adjacent walls, and an installer can place a shear key or use ship laps between adjacent modules. The interface between adjacent walls can be grouted or not grouted, and a product such as butyl mastic joint sealant or wrap can be used to seal the vertical joint between adjacent faces. The base can be textured or roughened to increase friction between the base and subsurface ground beneath the base, or set on shims with holes or ports for flow-able grout to increase the frictional force.

</summary>

<summary>
1. The present invention relates to systems and methods for producing or delivering heat at or near the down hole end of production tubing of a producing oil or gas well for improving production therefrom.
2. The invention addresses two primary shortcomings of conventional approaches to heating oil and paraffin down hole: the heat is not properly focused where it needs to be, and existing down hole heaters fail due to lack of design elements that protect electrical components from chemical or physical attack.
3. The down hole heating unit of the present invention is designed to overcome the problem of unit invasion by down hole fluids, which causes electrical shorts and corrosion, by providing adequate protection for the heating elements and their electrical connections.
4. The system is designed to focus and contain heat in the production zone to promote flow to, and not just within, the production tubing, using a heat insulating packer and stainless steel tubing collar to contain the heat.
5. The heating unit includes electrical resistance type heater rods, a cement block to shield the internal connections, and a steel fitting assembly to encase the cement block and provide a safe transition for the leads.
6. The present invention also includes a method for use of the system for heat treating an oil or gas well for improving well flow, which may be utilized by substituting cable for the down hole pipe for supporting the heating unit while pipe is pulled from the well bore.
</summary>

1. The invention relates to down hole tools for conducting mechanical activities in wells, specifically a mechanism for installing and removing objects in wells, including objects that might be stuck or lost within a well bore. The mechanism is designed to effectively connect a pull tool to a down hole object or fish and simple and effectively disconnect the pull tool from the article if desired. The invention is directed specifically to the improvement that promotes effective connection of a pull tool to a down hole object or fish and simple and effective disconnection of the pull tool from the article if such is desired. The invention is effectively adapted to be provided on a wire line controlled pulling tool and run into the well casing or well bore for the purpose of establishing a mechanical connection with an object positioned in the well bore.

2. The pulling tool mechanism is provided with a controllable locking mechanism that allows for selective control of the pulling tool mechanism to accomplish desired results. The locking mechanism incorporates a plurality of latching recesses and guide pins that are associated respectively with each of the recesses. The guide pins are selectively positioned within pin receiving grooves, and a control spring is employed to ensure that the pin alternately enters one or the other of a pair of unlocking or locking grooves each time the inner and outer body structures are cycled linearly relative to one another. The pulling tool mechanism may be unlatched simply by causing limited axial movement of the inner and outer housings and then causing relative movement of the inner and outer housings in the opposite direction.

3. The invention also includes an overshot pulling tool mechanism that functions from the latching and unlatching standpoint in similar manner as described above. The overshot mechanism includes an upper sub structure, an upper housing, and a latching mandrel portion that cooperates with an inner body structure to define an annulus or spring chamber adapted to receive a compression spring. The inner body structure is movably disposed within the latching mandrel portion of the outer body or housing of the tool mechanism, and the latching mandrel portion is provided with a plurality of guide pin elements. The guide pin elements are maintained in fixed relation with the latching mandrel and project into respective latching recesses.

4. The overshot mechanism may be latched and unlatched as many times as is appropriate to accomplish the service operation involved, and in the event the overshot type pulling tool is undersized for the particular pulling operation involved, it may be simply unlatched from the fish or from the down hole tool, removed from the well bore

1. The present application claims the benefit under 35 U.S.C. §365(a) of PCT International Patent Application Ser. No. PCT/MX2011/000063, filed May 25, 2011, which in turn claims priority to co-pending Mexico patent application Ser. Nos. MX/a/2011/005499 and MX/a/2010/005899. The entirety of the contents of each application is hereby incorporated by reference herein. The example embodiment in general relates to stave floors, in particular to modular composed stave floors. The present invention aims to improve the physical, aesthetic, and functional properties of composed stave floors.

2. The known stave floors have drawbacks, including a minimum material to be rushed for corrective maintenance of 1 mm, while the sight substrate has a thickness from 2 to 3 mm. The drawback of such a thin sight substrate thickness is that upon being sanded or rushed, the remaining material warms up and tends to be deformed and eventually becomes partially or completely detached. This affects the aesthetic properties of the final product since the forces of the mechanical action on “de-rolling” generate a sheet that will tend to curl or recover its cylindrical original form. The base substrate nowadays is composed of slung wood or is plated against (triplay).

3. The base substrate and sight substrate are joined by means of glue, which has several disadvantages, including the need to provide a uniform and level surface of assembly and to maintain a constant pressure to reach the desired adhesion. The cure or wait time for the glue to harden may stretch several days, during which the pieces must remain static without moving. The composed stave floors life is very short, and with no possibility of providing corrective maintenance. The materials are supplied pre-varnished from the supplier, but the thin thickness of the sheet does not offer a solid base of attachment.

4. The present invention aims to provide a method for the manufacture of composed stave floors, including providing a sight substrate having a thickness of at least 4 mm and providing a base substrate having a thickness of at least 12 mm. The base substrate and sight substrate are assembled together with glue and multidirectional holding means. The multidirectional holding means consist of dendrites, adhesion and horizontal reinforcement means, in the union plane; and adhesion and vertical reinforcement means, normal to the union plane.

5. The example embodiments will become more fully understood from the detailed description given herein below and the accompanying

<summary>

1. The invention relates to ladders and ladder attachments that position the ladder away from the work surface, preventing damage and slipping. The ladder attachment aims to provide lateral stability and prevent the ladder from defacing the work surface. The attachment is designed to increase the contact area between the ladder and the work surface, reducing the risk of damage. This is particularly useful when painting or cleaning the exterior of a house.

2. Typical ladders have a small contact area with the work surface, which can cause damage and instability. The ladder attachment addresses this issue by providing a broad surface area that does not dent, scrape, or mar the work surface. The attachment is designed to grip the work surface without damaging it, improving the lateral stability of the ladder. This is achieved through the use of a resilient pad assembly that pivotally connects to the ladder.

3. The ladder attachment consists of a brace assembly that includes an arm, a flange, and a U-bolt. The arm has a bore for vertically pivotally connecting the resilient pad assembly, and the flange has two openings for the U-bolt. The U-bolt encircles the rung of the ladder, securing the brace assembly in place. The arm and flange are preferably formed of a single piece of steel or other strong, durable material.

4. The ladder attachment is designed to be adjustable and can accommodate different sizes of ladders. The clamp that secures the arm to the siderail can be moved or adjusted to fit different ladder sizes. The opening in the arm may be an elongated opening or slot to allow for this adjustment. This makes the attachment versatile and suitable for use with various types of ladders.

5. The ladder attachment can be used to straddle corners, allowing the ladder to be positioned in a way that was previously not possible. The resilient pad assembly can be pivoted to contact opposite faces of a corner, providing stability and preventing the ladder from slipping. This is particularly useful when working on corners or edges of buildings. The attachment can be used on both inside and outside corners.

6. The invention provides a solution to the problems associated with typical ladders, including instability and damage to the work surface. The ladder attachment improves the lateral stability of the ladder, allowing it to be used in a variety of situations. The attachment is designed to be durable and long-lasting, making it a valuable addition to any ladder. The invention has many potential applications and can be modified to suit different needs and situations.</summary>

<summary>

1. The present invention relates to a collated nail strip formed with a debris-free plastic material for use in a fastener driving tool. The plastic material defines a collar portion that captures or at least substantially encircles the fastener shank and a connecting portion extending between and connecting adjacent collar portions. The plastic material is formulated from an adhesive polymer such as a polyolefin, a polyolefin blend, an epoxy or the like.

2. The nails are collated and held to one another by the plastic collation, which is molded to, over and around the shanks of the nails, and connects each nail to its adjacent nail or nails. The collation is formed as a contiguous molding around and between the nails; nevertheless, for purposes of this disclosure, the molding is viewed as having a collar portion and a connecting portion. The connecting portion provides the necessary rigidity to the strip that, in conjunction with the adhesive characteristics of the plastic, prevents corrugation of the strip.

3. The material is an adhesive polymer, an epoxy or the like, and can be, for example, an adhesive polyolefin such as a maleic anhydride modified polyolefin, such as polypropylene, polyethylene or the like. The material can include a blend of a polyolefin and a modified polyolefin, such as a blend of polypropylene and a maleic anhydride modified polypropylene. One or more other resins can also be used, such as a polyvinyl alcohol (PVA) based material, an ethylene vinyl alcohol (EVA) based material, an acrylonitrile butadiene styrene (ABS) based material, ionomers, methyl methacrylates and the like.

4. It has been found that unexpectedly high levels of adhesion were achieved using these modified resins when the resins were applied to nails that were heated to elevated temperatures prior to application of the polymer. Samples of nails were prepared by preheating the nails to a temperature of about 450° F. to about 600° F., and preferably about 500° F. to 550° F. and molding the maleic anhydride modified polypropylene to the nails. These were tested against other molded nail strip compositions, in which the molding was carried out with the nails at ambient temperature and with the nails at elevated temperatures.

5. The present nail strips exhibited a very limited amount of debris compared to known plastic collations,

1. The invention relates to devices for applying sealants such as silicones in various industries like aviation, automotive, naval, railway, and robotics. The invention is directed to a nozzle with a bell or hood lower section and an injection button, which is highly useful in applying silicone and similar sealants. The nozzle is designed to provide a precise and efficient application of sealants.

2. The manufacturing of machines and other related artifacts or accessories requires processes where the application of silicones and similar sealants is necessary. Sealants application requires the use of nozzles to apply said sealants to the machines or artifacts from a sealant-container. The sealant may be applied with a nozzle manually and directly from cartridges filled with sealant.

3. Some of the nozzles known in the art are made of metal and are intended to be reusable, particularly those meant to be used in injections machines. These nozzles must be cleaned up with solvent or products specifically prepared for such cleaning purpose, which are hazardous, abrasive, and highly irritant to the skin. The design of said nozzles does not allow their use with both manual cartridges and automatic processes using injection machines.

4. The invention overcomes the drawbacks and needs of the prior art by providing a nozzle with a bell or hood lower section and an injection button. The nozzle provides several advantageous and novel characteristics for its intended function inherent to its innovative organization and construction. The nozzle represents a considerable improvement with respect to what is currently known in the market in its field of application.

5. One of the main objectives of the invention is to provide a nozzle that facilitates the injection of silicone or other sealants in multiple industrial applications. Another objective of the invention is to provide a nozzle having an outlet shaped as a bell or hood to facilitate the encapsulation of rivets or screws. The nozzle also has an injection button coupled to the end section of said bell or hood.

6. The injection button has a special design with a number of channels and orifices for carrying out sealing operations with greater accuracy. The button allows guiding the injection of the sealant around the rivets and nuts. The nozzle provides a device that simplifies the sealing work in both the aesthetic appearance and speed of execution.

7. The nozzle comprises a main elongated hollow body having a truncated cone shape, a hollow round and threaded section, and a bell or hood shaped section. The main parts of the nozzle have the same elements already described previously, and the said sections are connected as previously described. The

<summary>
1. The present invention relates to sensors, particularly position and motion sensors, and provides a method of multiplexing multiple sensors on a minimum number of wires with a minimum of energy required from each sensor monitoring system. This is achieved through a position sensor signal conditioner and remotely electrically connected sensor monitoring equipment.

2. The invention includes a sensor that comprises a waveform generator and an error correction generator for modifying a sensing signal by removing unneeded power and providing the signal to a remote monitor via two wires. The waveform generator receives an unconditioned sensing signal from a transducer and modifies it in response to an error correction signal.

3. The error correction generator determines and eliminates strong static signals and error signals that do not deliver information about a position of an object being sensed, thereby reducing energy consumption. This is achieved through a digitally stored offset and error correction closed-loop compensation circuit.

4. The sensor includes a window reference circuit that constantly compares a desired conditioned sensor signal output to an existing conditioned sensor signal output and adjusts the conditioned sensor signal output if it is above a preset high reference signal or below a preset low reference signal. This ensures that the sensor output is within a desired range.

5. The sensor can be recalibrated at any time by external means by simply removing and reapplying power, and upon startup and initial calibration, the sensor draws a minimum of current. This is achieved through a preset that generates a pulse that causes the counter and DAC outputs to go to their highest value.

6. The sensor modulates a current across a pair of wires connected to the sensor monitoring system, where the modulated sensor current is converted into a modulated sensor signal voltage. This allows the sensor to operate with a minimum of energy and wiring requirements.</summary>

<summary>

1. The present invention relates to a desmodromic valve actuation system for intake and exhaust functions of a four-stroke piston in internal combustion engines, aiming to improve engine performance and reduce gasoline consumption. The system is designed to provide precise control over valve timing and displacement.

2. The standard method of controlling and operating valves in internal combustion engines uses a timing belt that connects the engine crankshaft to a camshaft, which has a series of cams that displace the valve inwardly to open the intake or exhaust port. However, this method has limitations, such as the inability to close the port openings, requiring the use of springs.

3. The present invention aims to provide a substantially infinitely variable valve actuation system that can be precisely controlled to present the most advantageous configuration of valving, including any percentage port opening on the intake cycle to closure of the intake port. This system can be computer-controlled and operates smoothly while the vehicle is traveling.

4. The invention eliminates the cam and spring method of valving with a essentially springless (desmodromic) kinematic system that positively controls the valve cycling and requires no springs. This system has considerable advantages, including power savings and the ability to run the engine at higher speeds.

5. The basic principal in the operation of an internal combustion engine is the requirement of the proper timing of opening and closing the valves for the 4 cycles of each piston. The present invention provides a valve actuation system that meets this requirement with a fixed displacement and is functional in the same capacity as the spring-cam system.

6. The variable displacement feature of the present invention allows for the valve stroke to be incrementally adjustable to its full opening and can also be controlled to close the valve port indefinitely while the engine is running. This feature is achieved through the use of a rotatable circular disk with a slotted cam track.

7. The control function of the valve assemblies is achieved through the use of a control block that captures the adjustment pin in slots parallel to the line of action of the slide assembly. The control block is constrained in lateral and axial directions to ensure a vertical up and down motion that maintains the juxtaposition of the slot parallel to the line of action.

8. The present invention can be applied to various engine designs, including those with multiple valves per cylinder, and offers significant advantages over the cam-spring system presently installed in automobiles, including improved performance, easier manufacturing and installation, and increased efficiency.

</summary>

The present invention relates to aquarium lighting, specifically using LEDs, and provides a light member with a housing having a top side and a bottom side, where the bottom side faces the interior of the aquarium. The light member includes a lighting control region disposed on the bottom side of the housing, which includes a first control channel, a second control channel, and a neutral channel. The lighting control region is sized to receive one or more light-emitting modules.

2. The light member includes a switch coupled to the housing, which is operable to control the first control channel, and a single power cord is coupled to the housing to provide electrical power to both control channels. The light member also includes one or more light-emitting modules that are releasably coupled to the lighting control region and to one of the channels. Each module includes a tab that releasably couples the module to a protrusion on the lighting control region.

The modules can be positioned anywhere along the lighting control region, and a single module or multiple modules may be added to or removed from the light member at various locations along the lighting control region as desired. Each module includes a bottom side that faces the interior of the aquarium and a top, connection side that faces the lighting control area. The connection side includes electrical connectors that couple to the control channels and the neutral channel.
